intro: Hieracium valdefastigiatum, commonly known as the Valley Bladderknotweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. It is often found in areas with rich, damp soil and can form dense colonies in suitable conditions.
